00010 Bleu::Bleu(vector<unsigned int> translation, vector<unsigned int> reference)
00011 {
00012         trans = translation;
00013         ref = reference;

00016 int Bleu::nGramsMatching(unsigned int n)
00017 {
00018         vector<bool>bitvec; // saves whether a ref-ngram  is already used or not.
00019         bitvec.resize(ref.size(),0);
00020 
00021         unsigned int nGramsMatchingCount=0;
00022         
00023         for (unsigned int i=0; i+n-1<trans.size(); i++)
00024         {
00025                 for (unsigned int j=0; j+n-1<ref.size(); j++)
00026                 {
00027                         if (bitvec[j]==0) // this ngram in the ref is not used yet
00028                         {
00029                                 //check if ngrams match
00030                                 unsigned int pos = 0;
00031                                 while ( pos < n
00032                                         && trans[i+pos] == ref[j+pos]
00033                                                                                         ) pos++;
00034                                 if (pos == n)
00035                                 {
00036                                         // matched
00037                                         nGramsMatchingCount++;
00038         
00039                                         // mark ngram in reference as used in the bitvector
00040                                         bitvec[j]=1;
00041                                         
00042                                         // dont count more occurrences in ref for this trans-ngram
00043                                         break; // for (..j..)
00044                                 }
00045                         }
00046                 }
00047         }
00048         return nGramsMatchingCount;
00049 }
00050 
00051 double Bleu::precision(unsigned int n)
00052 {
00053         int nGrams = trans.size() + 1 - n;
00054         return (double)nGramsMatching(n)/(double)nGrams;
00055 }
00056 
00057 double Bleu::brevityPenalty()
00058 {
00059         int c = this->trans.size();
00060         int r = this->ref.size();
00061 
00062         if (c > r)
00063                 return 1;
00064         if (c > 0) // (c <= r) gilt hier eh
00065                 return (double)exp(((double)(1-r)/(double)c));
00066 
00067         cerr << "Bleu::brevityPenalty(): Fehler bei der Berechnung. (Länge der Referenzübersetzung <= 0)" << endl;
00068         return -1;
00069 }
00070 
00071 double Bleu::bleuScore(unsigned int N)
00072 {
00073         if (N==0)
00074         {
00075                 cerr << "Bleu::bleuScore: ungültiges N (0)" << endl;
00076                 return 0;
00077         }
00078         /* um die Summe zu berechnen:
00079         * 1. 1/N kann man ausklammern
00080         * 2. log(a)+log(b) = log(a*b) => es reicht die p_n zu multiplizieren und am Ende einmal den log zu berechnen.
00081         */
00082         double akku = 1.0;
00083 
00084         // maybe there are less words in the trans or ref than we would try to get n-grams for.. so we search for the maximum N we can use here.
00085         unsigned int maxN = min((unsigned int)min(N, (unsigned int)trans.size()-1), (unsigned int)ref.size()-1);
00086         
00087         for (unsigned int i=1; i<=maxN; i++)
00088         {
00089                 double p = precision(i);
00090                 if (p>0)
00091                         akku *= p;
00092         }
00093         if (akku<=0)
00094                 return 0;
00095         return brevityPenalty()*exp(log(akku)/(double)maxN);
00096 }
